metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7828 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
FreeIPA 4.0.x before 4.0.5 and 4.1.x before 4.1.1, when 2FA is enabled, allows remote attackers to bypass the password requirement of the two-factor authentication leveraging an enabled OTP token, which triggers an anonymous bind.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7828` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-client - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-common - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-tests - 4.0.5-1
python-ipaclient - 4.0.5-1
python-ipalib - 4.0.5-1
python-ipaserver - 4.0.5-1
python-ipatests - 4.0.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> This is a FreeIPA 4.0.x issue, so marking Trusty as not affected Although Trusty also has the code, it differs from 4.0.x version

criterions.comment: freeipa package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5-1').
